question: Highlight the similarities and differences between latitudes and longitude
answer:
(a) Similarities of Latitude and Longitudes

(i) Both are imaginary lines

(ii) Both are drawn on the globe or map

(iii) Both are measured in degrees

(iv) Both are used for location of places or positions on the globe.

(v) Both are circular in shape

(b) Differences between Latitudes and Longitudes; 

(i) Latitudes are drawn from West to East, while longitudes a drawn from North to South

(ii) Latitudes are called parallels while longitudes are called meridians

(iii) Longitudes are used to calculate time, while latitudes are not

(iv) Only the equator is a Great Circle among the latitudes while all lines of longitudes form Great Circles with their opposite members

(v) Latitudes are parallel and never meet while longitudes converge and meet at the poles.

question:
With the aid of diagrams, describe the characteristic and mode of formation of any two of the following:

(a) Rock pedestal (b) Yardang (c) Mesa
answer:
(a) ROCK PEDESTALS:
Characteristics:

  • It has soft and hard rock layers, mushroom with irregular shape formed in desert e.g Sahara desert
  • The soft rock layers is eroded more rapidly resulting in the formation of irregular edge of alternate bands of hard and soft rock.
  • Further erosion at the base produces a mushroom-shaped feature .

(ii) YANDANG: This is an erosional  feature formed by wind abrasion in  desert e.g Atacama desert. It has vertical bands or hard and soft rocks  of height between 5-15cm.
Characteristics:

  • Yandang is found in the desert.
  • Vertical bands of hard and soft rocks standing in the direction of prevailing wind is eroded such that Rock the softer rock is eroded faster than the hard rock resulting in the formation of Yandang.

question:
Distinguish between the tropical grassland and temperate grassland under the following headings

(a) Location (b) Climate (c) Vegetation characteristics
answer:
(a) Location: Tropical grasslands are located in the tropics while temperate grasslands are located in temperate latitude. Again tropical grasslands are found between 10° and 30° North and South while temperate grassland are found between 30° and 40° North and South of the Equator

(b) Climate: Tropical grassland has moderate rainfall (25-150cm) while temperate grassland has lower rainfall (40-50cm) Tropical grassland is not all the year round but temperate grassland has cold winter and warm summers. In tropical grassland, summer temperature is 32°C and 21°C while temperate grassland has 18°C in summer and —19°C in winter.

(c) Characteristics: Tropical grassland contains scattered trees while temperate grassland is almost treeless. Trees in the tropical grassland are bigger than those of temperate-grassland.jropical grasses are tough while temperate grasses are succulent. Example of tropical grass is elephant grass while temperate grass is willow.

question:
(a) Explain the following terms:
(i) Over-population;
(ii) Migration

(b) Describe any three factors which encourage the occurrence of each term in (a) above within a population group
answer:
(a)(i) Over-population is a situation where a country has more people than its physical and human resources can support with adequate living standard

(ii) Migration is the movement of people on a seasonal, or permanent basis from their original location to another.

(b)(i) Three factors responsible for over-population include:

(a) Low level of education

(b) The culture of the people/large family size)

(c) High birth rate

(ii) Three factors responsible for migration include; 

(a) Environmental hazards e.g earthquake, floods, drought

(b) Low standard of living -search for greener pastures

(c) Fear of insecurity e.g War, Political instability etc.

question:

(ii) It can move mails, passengers and high value cargo

(iii) It can cover long distances

(b) Three disadvantages of air transportation includes

(i) High cost of transportation fares

(i) Government subsidy of airfares

(ii) Training of flight and technical crew

question:

(i) Inadequate labour
- rural depopulation
- drift to the towns/ mines etc leaving old people on the farm

(ii) Land tenure system giving rise to fragmentation of farm holding

(iii) Inadequate capital

(iv) Use of crude implements e.g hoe, cutlass etc.

(b) Three effects of the above problems on the economic development of Nigeria are:

(i) High prices of agricultural products

(ii) Shortage of foods

(ii) Reduction of income to farmers/government

(c) Solutions to the above problems in (a);

(ii) Introduction of land reforms

(iii) Granting !cans to farmers

question:
Write a geographical account of the Chad basin under the following headings:

(a) Relief and drainage

(b)Agriculture

(c) Problems of development
answer:
(a) Relief and drainage

(i) The Chad basin is a low-lying area of an average elevation of 45-60m above the sea-level. It is poorly drained and rivers flow into the Lake Chad e.g Hadeija, Gana and Yobe rivers

(b) Agriculture: Farming types include fishing, cattle rearing, irrigation, arable farming, mixed farming etc. Products of agriculture include food crops like groundnut, vegetables, beans, rice, millet, etc while animal products 
include beef, milk, hides and skin, fish etc

(c) problems of development include: Drought, desert encroachment, inadequate natural resources, soil erosion, inadequate capital and low level of technology.

(b) Five problems of ECOWAS include:
